text:
> Do people usually think community managers do something else?
It seems that, at least for most of the marketers I spoke with about this role, yes.

When I workshopped the job description with other hiring managers, the near-universal feedback I got was that the traditional community manager role — on _their_ teams — was focused inward, i.e. building a community centered around the product/company, rather than being embedded in the greater community being served by the business.

To be fair, I’ve seen community managers acting in both (inward- and outward-focused) roles, but my assumption was that the former was the more “traditional” of the two.

But I’m not a community manager! :wink:
